result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel J Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $25 per month commencing 12--01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 5 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel J Cruz

Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Gabriel J Cruz in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.

Defendant has completed his DV counseling.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $379
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid at the rate of $25 per month, starting 12/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  5  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
